section.name: Module 3
section.summary:
This module is divided into five separate but closely related components: The first component, Introduction to Module 3, provides a broad overview of key concepts related to designing and implementing an adult ELA program contextualized for career pathways. The main purpose of this introduction is to outline the why of contextualized ELA instruction.

This module contains four units which provide more detail on the how of implementing various aspects of an effective contextualized program. Estimated completion time for each unit is 2-3 hours.  A certificate can be earned for each unit upon completion of the unit activities. There are additional materials within the units that provide for deeper learning opportunities.  These optional deeper learning opportunities will take time beyond the estimated 2-3 hours for completion.

These units should be useful to instructors and administrators.

Review the Introduction to Module 3 to begin.
